class.name: wxDialog
class.description: A dialog box is a window with a title bar and sometimes a system menu, which can be moved around the screen.

flag.name: wxDEFAULT_DIALOG_STYLE
flag.description: Equivalent to a combination of wxCAPTION, wxCLOSE_BOX and wxSYSTEM_MENU (the last one is not used under Unix).

flag.name: wxCAPTION
flag.description: Puts a caption on the dialog box.

flag.name: wxMINIMIZE_BOX
flag.description: Displays a minimize box on the dialog.

flag.name: wxMAXIMIZE_BOX
flag.description: Displays a maximize box on the dialog.

flag.name: wxCLOSE_BOX
flag.description: Displays a close box on the dialog.

flag.name: wxSTAY_ON_TOP
flag.description: The dialog stays on top of all other windows.

flag.name: wxRESIZE_BORDER
flag.description: Display a resizable frame around the window.

flag.name: wxNO_3D
flag.description: Under Windows, specifies that the child controls should not have 3D borders unless specified in the control.

flag.name: wxDIALOG_NO_PARENT
flag.description: By default, a dialog created with a NULL parent window will be given the application's top level window as parent. Use this style to prevent this from happening and create an orphan dialog. This is not recommended for modal dialogs.

flag.name: wxDIALOG_EX_CONTEXTHELP
flag.description: Under Windows, puts a query button on the caption. When pressed, Windows will go into a context-sensitive help mode and wxWidgets will send a wxEVT_HELP event if the user clicked on an application window. Note that this is an extended style and must be set by calling SetExtraStyle() before Create is called (two-step construction).

flag.name: wxDIALOG_EX_METAL
flag.description: On Mac OS X, frames with this style will be shown with a metallic look. This is an extra style.

event.name: wxCloseEvent
event.description: This event class contains information about window and session close events.

type.name: wxEVT_CLOSE
type.description: The frame is being closed by the user or programmatically (see wxWindow::Close). The user may generate this event clicking the close button (typically the 'X' on the top-right of the title bar) if it's present (see the wxCLOSE_BOX style).

event.name: wxInitDialogEvent
event.description:
A wxInitDialogEvent is sent as a dialog or panel is being initialised.

Handlers for this event can transfer data to the window.

The default handler calls wxWindow::TransferDataToWindow.
